de.systemagmbh.common.logger
Class CSysLog

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.common.logger.CSysLog
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISysDevelopmentLogSwitch, ISysGlobal, ISysLogConstants
public class CSysLog
extends Object
implements ISysLogConstants

The CSysLog class provides a number of static methods for logging. It allows the user to call a single static method to log the text to each logger added before in ISysLoggerManager.
But it also provides a log method that logs to a concrete logger.

ATTENTION:
The components will always log via CSysLog. They can not support the usage of a individual logger within an application.
The reason is simple:
The components do not know the application they belong to.

log

public static void log(ISysComponent component,
                       Object toBeLogged,
                       int level,
                       Properties formatterData)
Log msg to all loggers if the current logging level is less than or equal to is given log level.

Parameters:
component - The component that logs.
toBeLogged - The object that has to be logged.
level - Verbose level.
formatterData - Special properties to be set in the conctete ISysLogFormatter implementation.

log

public static void log(String componentType,
                       Object toBeLogged,
                       int level,
                       Properties formatterData)
Log msg to all loggers if the current logging level is less than or equal to is given log level.

Parameters:
componentType - The type of the component that logs.
toBeLogged - The object that has to be logged.
level - Verbose level.
formatterData - Special properties to be set in the conctete ISysLogFormatter implementation. E.g. for the name of the class that called the log method.
